RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRIVATE DESIRE showed good speed on the outside of a rival, moved to a solo lead near the nine-sixteenths, was challenged to his outside at the half-mile pole, vied in the two path on the turn, was asked near the quarter-pole, lost the lead to the runner-up in upper stretch, responded well and fought back to regain the advantage near the furlong marker, passed the sixteenth-pole under a right-handed crop and prevailed under good handling. HURRICANE NELSON broke very fast and went straight to the front, gave up the lead when joined on the outside by the winner early, was taken back off the pace outside the nine-sixteenths then switched to the outside, moved up to make an outside bid at the half-mile pole, was asked in the three path on the turn, took a short lead in upper stretch, lost the advantage back to that foe near the eighth-pole, drifted in closer to the winner in the final furlong and was outfinished while well clear for the place. HEARTENED was last to commence, raced well off the pace under urging, went three wide on the turn, came four wide into the stretch and was along for the show. IGNITE THE LIGHT was well placed just off the pace, dropped back in the two path on the turn, was driven three wide into the stretch and came up empty. COMMANDER OF TRUTH angled out under urging early then chased the pace on the outside, dropped back in the four path on the turn, spun five wide into the stretch and tired. BOUNTEOUS dropped well behind while void of speed, moved from the four path to the two path on the turn and was no factor. HEDGE THE RISK was coaxed along on the inside, dropped back while saving ground on the turn and capitulated.

ENTRY.NAME: Hedge the Risk
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed along,inside turn,retreated

ENTRY.NAME: Ignite the Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, 2path turn, 3path into lane, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Commander of Truth
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled out,chased outside,drop back 4p turn,5p1/4,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Heartened
ENTRY.OWNER: St Elias Stable Langone Ken Duncker C Steven and Vicarage Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away,urged along,3wide turn,4w into lane,along for show

ENTRY.NAME: Bounteous
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, 4-2path turn, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Hurricane Nelson
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk vry fast,gave up lead,tkn back,mvd out,bid1/2,3p,led3/16,miss

ENTRY.NAME: Private Desire
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed outside,solo lead4-1/2,2p turn,headed3/16,responded,best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 98. Allowance Purse 100000. (UP TO $17,400 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VICTORIOUS WAVE coaxed from the gate, chased three wide coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, swung four then three wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command near the eighth pole, inched away under a drive to prevail. OCEAN'S RESERVE five then four wide in pursuit, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and went six wide into upper stretch, kicked on belatedly to secure the place honors. KOOL KATHMANDU led early on briefly before being displaced on the front by BEZOS, chased that rival in closest aim just off the inside, got let out continuing just off the inside into upper stretch, took brief command at the three-sixteenths, got headed for the front nearing the eighth pole and shied in a bit sharply being flashed the crop to the right side at that station, ran on shying in a bit more slight at the sixteenth marker when shown the crop to the right side once more and was along clear for the show honors. CAPONE coaxed from the gate, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch and was one paced through to the finish. BEZOS away near the rear of the field without incident, advanced inside early on to take over command five furlongs from home, showed the way in hand coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, took the inside route into upper stretch under threat, yielded the front at the three-sixteenths and weakened. SUGAR GRAY LEONARD stumbled at the start conceding three to four lengths to the front before being able to settle into stride, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, swung two to three wide into upper stretch and was unable to make an impact. LEDDY broke slow and then was sluggish early on and was guided outside to be six paths off the rail down the backstretch, tucked four wide through the turn coming under coaxing midway, cornered five wide into upper stretch and trailed throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Bezos
ENTRY.COMMENT: ranged up ins, up 5/8, in hand ins, ins 1/4p, yielded 3/16, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Sugar Gray Leonard
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 2-3w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Leddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, sluggish early 6w, 4w turn, 5w uppr, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Capone
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 4-3w, coaxed 3/8, angled 6w upper, one paced

ENTRY.NAME: Kool Kathmandu
ENTRY.COMMENT: led early,chased 2p, 2w 1/4, up 3/16, shied in 1/8 & 1/16, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Victorious Wave
ENTRY.OWNER: Epona Racing Stable and Toga Party Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 3w pursuit, 4-3w uppr, up near 1/8, inched away

ENTRY.NAME: Ocean's Reserve
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5-4w, coaxed near 1/4, 6w upper, belatedly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 3 1 1/16M Outer turf CR: 86. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. OUTER TURF (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 36 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RHIANNON stalked the pace on the outside in the two path, engaged the leader on the far turn, was asked while taking the advantage outside the quarter-pole, kicked clear in upper stretch and powered away under a solid hand-ride to prove much the best. AKAYLA (IRE) broke out at the start, settled on the inside, was roused on the far turn, moved out in upper stretch and safely secured the place while no match for the winner. WAR PRINCESS went to the front, showed the way on the inside, was asked with three furlongs to run, lost the lead outside the quarter-pole, dropped back into upper stretch and weakened but was clear for the show. VANISHED went three wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, was asked three wide on the far turn, chased into the stretch and came up empty. AFRICAN WATERS broke awkwardly and was slow to begin, was carried out early, went three wide on the first turn, settled at the back, was roused three wide on the far turn, came five wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. PIPPI LONGSTOCKING was off slow and spotted the front a few lengths, angled in at the rear, settled on the inside, was given her cue on the far turn, turned into the stretch in the two path and failed to respond. MISS OUR HERO was taken in hand at the start then dropped back, angled out early, rounded the first turn in the four path, settled on the outside, was asked three wide on the far turn, came four wide into the stretch and also failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: War Princess
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside pace,asked 3/8,headed outside 1/4,weakened,clear 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Akayla (IRE)
ENTRY.OWNER: Team Hanley Drown Jeffrey Schermerhorn Richard and Ryan Michael J
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,settld ins,asked 2nd turn,mvd out3/16,secured place

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Our Hero
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand start,4w1st,settled outside,ask3w2nd,4w1/4,no response

ENTRY.NAME: African Waters
ENTRY.OWNER: Allen Stable Inc and Gainesway Stable (Antony Beck)
ENTRY.COMMENT: akwrd st,off slw,carried out early,3p1st,settld,3p2nd,5w,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Vanished
ENTRY.OWNER: Eclipse Thoroughbred Partners Barber Gary and Rocco Steven
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p1st,settled outside,ask3p2nd turn,came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Rhiannon
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked outside 2path,bid2nd turn,lead outside1/4,powered away

ENTRY.NAME: Pippi Longstocking
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow,angled in,settled inside,ask2nd turn,2p1/4,no response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 90. Claiming Purse 48000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At T ime Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).

CLAIM.OWNER: Two B and One C Stable

RACE.FOOTNOTES: AIR SHOW chased along the inside coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, swung three wide into upper stretch, angled in to the inside at the three-sixteenths, rallied up the rail to take command nearing the sixteenth marker, then edged away to the finish kept to task. QUICKFLASH coaxed from the gate, dueled along the inside of POPPY'S PRIDE early on before being shaken off by that foe, tipped out and advanced once more from the two path midway on the turn to knock heads again, swung four wide into upper stretch, continued the duel through to the finish getting displaced in tandem from the front nearing the sixteenth pole and ran on to best his pace rival for the place honors by a sliver. POPPY'S PRIDE coaxed from the start, dueled from the three path with QUICKFLASH to his inside down the backstretch, shook off that rival and tucked inside half a mile from home, had that foe advance once more midway on the turn now engaging from the outside and dueled again from the three-eighths, swung three wide into upper stretch, continued the head to head combat through to the wire getting overtaken by the top one as a pair near the sixteenth marker, ran on but was just bested for the place honors while clear for the show. FLAMINGO HAWK coaxed from the gate, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild bid. PRINCE JAMES chased three wide, got nudged four wide by BUSTIN SHOUT near the half mile pole, chased four then three wide through the turn nudging that rival back inwards with three furlongs to go, swung five wide for home and offered no response. BUSTIN SHOUT chased just off the inside, tipped out three wide nudging PRINCE JAMES four wide near the half mile pole, was inside that rival and got leaned on slightly and nudged back to the two path midway on the turn, angled four wide into upper stretch and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Prince James
ENTRY.OWNER: River Card Stable and Jacobson David
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, nudged 4w 1/2, 5w upper, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Air Show
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, coaxed near 1/4, 3w upper, to ins 3/16, edged away

ENTRY.NAME: Quickflash
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, dueled ins early, came again 2p 3/8, 4w uppr, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Bustin Shout
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, nudged foe 4w 1/2, 3-2w turn, 4w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Flamingo Hawk
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased inside, coaxed 5/16, angled 4w upper, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Poppy's Pride
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, dueled 3p early, to ins 1/2, 3w upper, dug in, ran on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 5 1 3/8M Turf CR: 100. Allowance Purse 100000. (UP TO $17,400 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile and One Quarter on the Main Track.) (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CATCH THAT PARTY was off slow and spotted the front a few lengths, saved ground while unhurried at the rear, went three wide on the final turn, swung six wide into upper stretch, was corrected off heels with a tug of the left-rein outside the eighth-pole, rallied into the final furlong, closed fast into the final sixteenth and blew by the leading duo to win going away. CYBER NINJA saved ground on the first turn, settled off the pace, went around the second turn in the two path, continued off the rail down the backstretch, was asked on the final turn, came three wide into the stretch, chased under a drive into the final furlong, gained to make a bid into the final sixteenth and finished with good courage for the place while unable to match strides with the winner. ROYAL SPIRIT was taken in hand early, saved ground on the first turn, moved closer to the lead near the wire for the first time, rounded the second turn in the two path, tracked outside down the backstretch, made a bid on the final turn, turned into upper stretch on even terms for the lead, dueled with a foe into the final sixteenth and was outfinished while just able to get the show. LAUREL VALLEY angled in while going to the front, showed the way while inside on the turns, was asked outside the quarter-pole, spun off the rail under left-rein guidance into the stretch, dueled with ROYAL SPIRIT into the final sixteenth and was out-kicked then just missed the show. HOLD THE SALSA settled while two to three wide, was asked along the rail on the final turn, chased the vanguard in the stretch and lacked the needed kick. SCRAMBLE broke in and bumped with a foe, settled outside while three to four wide, ranged up on the final turn, was asked outside the quarter-pole, raced off heels while remaining on his inside lead in upper stretch, chased while put to a right-handed crop nearing the furlong marker and weakened then was reported to have bled. RAMBLIN' WRECK was bumped at the start, settled in the two to three path, was roused on the final turn, came five wide into the stretch and lacked the needed response. BEE MAJOR went three then two wide on the first turn, settled off the pace, saved ground on the second turn, continued inside down the backstretch, came up empty along the rail under urging on the final turn and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Cyber Ninja
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins1st,settled,2p2nd,ask2p3rd,3w1/4,chased,good courage,up2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Catch That Party
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow,unhurried ins,3w3rd trn,swung 6w3/16,closed fast,blew by

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand,ins1st,tracked,2p2nd,bid 2p3rd turn,dueled,outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Hold the Salsa
ENTRY.OWNER: The Estate of Richard J Lugovich
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2-3path,asked rail 3rd turn,chased,lacked needed kick

ENTRY.NAME: Bee Major
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2p1st,settled,ins2nd,empty rail 3rd turn,faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Ramblin' Wreck
ENTRY.OWNER: Reeves Thoroughbred Racing Searles Peter and Searles Patty
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,settled 2-3path,ask3rd turn,5w1/4,lckd needed response

ENTRY.NAME: Scramble
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in,bmpd,3-4w,out,ask1/4,off heels,inside lead,wknd,bled

ENTRY.NAME: Laurel Valley
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in,clear pace,ins turns,ask1/4,2p into lane,dueled,outkckd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 6 6F Outer turf CR: 75. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. OUTER TURF (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 36 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EVER SO SWEET (IRE) dueled from the two path with PROGENY to her outside, shook off that rival near the quarter pole and took the inside route into upper stretch, got let out straightened away and edged clear to the eighth pole, dug in and held safe to the finish. AGRA chased three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four to five wide into upper stretch, closed well to secure the place honors latching on the aforementioned foe as she hit the finish. MITOLE MAGIC broke in at the start, chased along the inside, got set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and ran on to secure the show honors. DON'T SAY IT chased two to three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued two to three wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick. WAY TO BE MARIE coaxed from the gate, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled four wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and was under a right handed crop nearing the eighth pole when the rider lost the handle on it before improving position to the finish. VILLI OLENTO shied in at the start in reaction to MITOLE MAGIC, who broke inwards, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, cut the corner into upper stretch and offered no response. MAYFLY broke in at the start and was corrected, chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled four wide into upper stretch and tired. LA PICASITA struck the near side stall at the start, chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled four wide into upper stretch and made no impact. PROGENY coaxed from the gate, dueled from three path with EVER SO SWEET to her inside, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, got shaken off near the quarter pole, retreated and went three wide into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Villi Olento
ENTRY.OWNER: Wachtel Stable and Pantofel Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: shied in st, chased ins, coaxed 3/8, cut corner, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Mitole Magic
ENTRY.OWNER: First Row Partners Heiligbrodt L William and Heiligbrodt Corinne
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, chased ins, set down 2w 1/4p, dug in, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Way to Be Marie
ENTRY.OWNER: LaPenta Robert V and Madaket Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased ins, coaxed 3/8, 4w uppr, lost crop, improved

ENTRY.NAME: La Picasita
ENTRY.OWNER: Miranda Katie Rosen Fred Steinmetz Equine Holdings LLC and New Phoenix Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate st, chased 2p, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Agra
ENTRY.OWNER: Claiborne Farm and Dilschneider, Adele B.
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, angled 4-5w upper, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Ever So Sweet (IRE)
ENTRY.OWNER: Hoffman Gregory M RT Racing Stable and Scherer Clay
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2p, ins 1/4, let out str away, edged clear, held safe

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: G. H. S. Bloodstock & J. C. Bloodstock

ENTRY.NAME: Mayfly
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, chased 2p, coaxed 3/8, angled 4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Say It
ENTRY.OWNER: Full of Run Racing Two and Ten Strike Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 5/16, 2-3w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Progeny
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, dueled 3w, coaxed 3/8, retreated 3w upper, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 94. Starter Allowance Purse 65000. (UP TO $11,310 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SKYLANDER was well placed just off the pace, drafted in the two path on the turn, waited while lacking room behind horses from the quarter-pole into upper stretch, was asked while altering out inside the three-sixteenths, accelerated to the front into the final furlong and drew away under steady urging. WARRIOR RICHARD settled off the pace, drafted along the rail on the turn, waited behind horses at the quarter-pole, shifted out four wide into upper stretch, chased into the final furlong and narrowly earned the place while no match for the winner. THUNDERIAN dropped well behind the rest of the field, saved ground on the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and improved to just miss the place while able to get the show. KUNSHAN BRIDGE showed speed between horses, dropped off the pace inside the three-quarter pole then moved out, tracked the pace from that point, moved up to make an outside bid at the half-mile pole, vied in the four then three path on the turn, came under a drive in upper stretch, battled into the final furlong and proved no match for the winner then lost the trifecta. AMERICAN LAW showed speed on the outside then contested the pace, vied in the three then two path on the turn, battled under a drive into the final furlong and weakened. ARREBATO settled off the pace, was roused three wide on the turn and lacked the needed response. RIDE UP bobbled after the start, showed speed on the inside of foes then contested the pace, vied in the two path early on the turn then moved to the rail, dropped back into upper stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderian
ENTRY.COMMENT: at rear,inside turn,improved,missed 2nd,earned show

ENTRY.NAME: Skylander
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed,drafted 2p turn,wait1/4-3/16,alter out,rallied,clear

ENTRY.NAME: Warrior Richard
ENTRY.OWNER: AB Racing LLC and Crown Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,drafted rail turn,wait1/4,shift 4w3/16,up for place

ENTRY.NAME: Arrebato
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, roused 3wide turn, failed to rally

ENTRY.NAME: Ride Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled after brk,speed ins duo,pace,2p-inside turn,faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Kunshan Bridge
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed btwn,drop back 5-1/2,mvd out,bid1/2,4-3path turn,lost tri

ENTRY.NAME: American Law
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed outside,pace,vied 3-2path turn,battled past1/8,weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 106. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 102000. (UP TO $17,748 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Ol der, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void ).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DURANTE lunged at the break, quickly advanced to take over the front, showed the way in hand four paths off the inside down the backstretch before tucking to the two path through the turn, continued just off the inside into upper stretch and was let out straightened away, drew off under a drive to prevail. VITTORIO got bumped at the start by TOPS THE CHART due to pressure from SHIVAREE, chased just off the inside until tucked inside into the turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled three wide for home, proved no match for the top one while running on to secure the place honors. CASTLE CHAOS got bumped at the start by JAKE ROCKS, who broke inwards, chased three then two wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and kicked on belatedly to secure the show honors. EMERALD FOREST chased three to four wide until tucked to the two path through the turn, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled four to five wide into upper stretch and improved position to the finish. SEVEN NATION ARMY chased six paths off the inside down the backstretch and then four wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and weakened. TOPS THE CHART broke open the stall door prior to the start just after TWENTY FOUR MAMBA grew fractious, got bumped at the start by SHIVAREE and in turn bumped VITTORIO, chased three then two wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, spun two to three wide for home and weakened. JAKE ROCKS broke in at the start bumping CASTLE CHAOS, chased along the inside coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, swung three wide at the head of the stretch and weakened. TWENTY FOUR MAMBA grew fractious in the gate inspiring TOPS THE CHART to break open his stall door, chased along the inside until tipped to the two path half a mile from home, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled out six wide into upper stretch and made no impact. KING ANGELO chased five paths off the inside down the backstretch and then three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch and tired. SHIVAREE broke in at the start bumping TOPS THE CHART into VITTORIO, chased seven paths off the inside down the backstretch and then four wide through the turn coaxed along from midway, went six to seven wide into upper stretch and made no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Durante
ENTRY.COMMENT: lunge st, in hand 4p, 2p turn, 2w 1/4, let out str away, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Twenty Four Mamba
ENTRY.OWNER: PlayingTheField Racing Final Turn Racing Stable LLC WLIR Racing Stables and Acqu
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate, chased ins, to 2p 1/2, angled 6w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Castle Chaos
ENTRY.OWNER: Goldfarb Sanford J Nice Guys Stables and Beast Mode Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Jake Rocks
ENTRY.OWNER: FIN Stables and Sal-Lou J G Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, chased inside, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.OWNER: Krakow Racing LLC and Five Horsemen Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-4w, coaxed 2p 3/8, 4-5w upper, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Vittorio
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 2p, ins turn, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Tops the Chart
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 2-3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Shivaree
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, 7w backstretch, coaxed 4w 3/8, 6-7w upper, no impact

ENTRY.OWNER: Rodriguez Gustavo and Wojdyla Randall S
ENTRY.COMMENT: 6w backstretch, 4w turn, coaxed 5/16, 5w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: King Angelo
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w backstretch, 3w turn, coaxed 3/8, 5-6w upper, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Fasig-Tipton Jockey Club Oaks Invitational S. - Grade3 BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 9 1 3/8M Turf CR: 101. Stakes Purse 350000. AN INVITATIONAL FOR FILLIES, THREE-YEARS-OLD. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. $1,750 to enter and an additional $1,750 to start. The purse for the Fasig-Tipton Jockey Club Oaks Invitational sha ll be divided as follows: $192,500 to the owner of the winner, $70,000 to second, $42,000 to third, $21,000 to fourth, $14,000 fifth and $10,500 divided equally amonst the remaining finishers. Weight: 122 lbs. Trophies will be presented to the winning own er, trainer and jockey. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to transfer this race to the Main Track. In the event that this race is taken off the turf it may be subject to downgrading upon review by the Graded Stakes Committee. (If the Stew ards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile and One Quarter on the Main Track.) (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ETERNAL HOPE (IRE) was last into stride, raced in the two path while unhurried at the rear, was roused while moving from the three path to the five path on the final turn, rallied six wide into the stretch, closed strongly to make a bid outside the sixteenth-pole, fought with the runner-up to the finish and narrowly prevailed under strong urging. NEECIE MARIE was hustled from the gate then taken in hand early, settled while inside to the two path, was urged in the two path on the final turn, gained three wide into the stretch, moved in while chasing into the final furlong, made a bid outside the sixteenth-pole, battled with the winner to the finish and just missed while able to get the place. SPEIRLING BEAG (IRE) settled in the two to three path, was asked while three then four wide on the final turn, rallied five wide into the stretch, closed well to make a bid inside the furlong marker but was outfinished late while able to get the show. HIGHLAND GRACE settled in the two to three path, was asked on the final turn, came four wide into the stretch, rallied to make a bid inside the furlong marker but was out-kicked and missed the trifecta. QUARREL showed in front early, was taken in hand when joined on the outside into the first turn, raced in the two to three path while placed under vigorous restraint on that bend, followed the solo leader while rated in clear second position, gained on the tiring pacesetter while moving from the rail to the three path on the far turn, took the lead while asked for her best in upper stretch, lost the advantage outside the sixteenth-pole and weakened. STEPHANIE'S CHARM went to the front entering the first turn, sped clear while in the four to five path on that bend, opened up a huge advantage, traveled around the second turn in the three then four path, continued with a very large advantage down the backstretch, shortened stride in the two path on the final turn, was collared into upper stretch and capitulated. LAST CALL settled on the inside, was urged along on the final turn and faltered.

ENTRY.OWNER: Lanni Bloodstock and SF Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside,urged final turn,faltered

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 10 6F Outer turf CR: 77. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. OUTER TURF (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 36 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROSIE JEEKS established the front after the start and showed the way in hand along the inside, took the inside route into upper stretch, got let out straightened away and drifted safely to the two path, edged clear to the eighth pole, held clear to the finish to prevail. BEETS broke slowly, chased four wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four to five wide into upper stretch, ran on willingly to secure the place honors. INTO STARS broke out at the start and came under coaxing leading briefly early on before being displaced by the top one, backed off to chase just off the inside in closest aim, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and spun just off the inside into upper stretch, kept on to preserve the show honors. STREET VIEW two to three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, weakened in the late stages. NADOWESSI (IRE) broke in hitting the near side stall at the start and then crossed paths in behind INTO STARS, chased just off the inside, got set down spinning three wide into upper stretch, weakened. ARCHIVIST broke out at the start bumping TAP THE KEG, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, cornered just off the inside into upper stretch and tired. THAT'STHEFACTJACK three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled four wide into upper stretch and tired. DAISY'S ANGEL broke a half a beat slow and was bumped by KING'S DAUGHTER due to pressure from TAP THE KEG breaking outwards, chased three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung five wide for home and made no impact. TAP THE KEG broke out at the start bumping KING'S DAUGHTER into DAISY'S ANGEL, and then got bumped by ARCHIVIST come outwards from along her inside, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, cut the corner into upper stretch and faltered. KING'S DAUGHTER got bumped at the start by TAP THE KEG and in turn bumped DAISY'S ANGEL, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung three wide into upper stretch and made no impact.
